meanings.definition: To use spells or verbal charms in a ritual or ceremony.
meanings.sent1: She incants ancient words to cast a protective spell.
meanings.sent2: The witch incants a spell to summon the spirits.
meanings.sent3: The wizard incants loudly, hoping to turn his cat into a dragon.
meanings.sent4: Her voice incants the air, weaving magic into existence.
meanings.sent5: The sorcerer incants with power, bending reality to his will.

meanings.definition: A magical formula or spell used in incantation.
meanings.sent1: The incants of the enchantress were whispered in the wind.
meanings.sent2: He found an ancient book filled with powerful incants.
meanings.sent3: The children giggled as they made up silly incants to ward off monsters.
meanings.sent4: The incants of the old wizard echoed through the forest, enchanting all who heard.
meanings.sent5: The sacred incants were written on a scroll, guarded by mystical creatures.

meanings.definition: To recite a series of words as a magical charm or spell.
meanings.sent1: The magician incants the words that will unlock the hidden door.
meanings.sent2: In the dark cave, the sorceress incants softly to protect herself.
meanings.sent3: The bard incants a humorous spell, causing everyone to burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: His incants echoed in the chamber, filling the space with mystical energy.
meanings.sent5: She incants with precision, each word carrying the weight of ancient magic.
